name: Gihan R. Mudalige
content: Gihan Mudalige Skip to main content Skip to navigation Professor of High-Performance ComputingMember of ACMI am a Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Warwick, where I lead the High Performance and Scientific Computing (HPSC) Group. My research focuses on advancing high-performance numerical simulation software, with particular emphasis on targeting massively parallel architectures, reconfigurable computing systems, and compiler/code-generation technologies. The research underpins the development of OP2 and OPS, two of the earliest domain-specific languages (DSLs) to demonstrate the utility of high-level abstraction techniques for developing production-grade HPC applications.My research has been supported through collaborations with leading academic and industrial partners, including Rolls-Royce plc, the UK Turbulence Consortium (UKTC), the Numerical Algorithms Group (NAG), the Alan Turing Institute, the Science and Technology Facilities Council (STFC), and IBM TJ Watson Research Center. In 2018, I was awarded a Royal Society Industry Fellowship with Rolls-Royce plc., on developing future-ready massively-parallel CFD simulations for Exascale HPC systems. I was a Co-I of the £7M, Strategic Partnership in Computational Science for Advanced Simulation and Modelling of Engineering Systems (ASiMoV) project funded by EPSRC and Rolls-Royce and the £2.6M ExCALIBUR project on “Turbulence at the Exascale - Application to Wind Energy, Green Aviation, Air Quality and Net-zero Combustion”. I am also a Co-I of the recently awarded £17M, Virtual Exascale Calculations Transform Aviation (VECTA) project funded by UKRI and Rolls-Royce. My work in ASiMoV was the recipient of the 2022 Scientific Visualization and Data Analytics Showcase award at the Supercomputing (SC) conference.Before joining Warwick in 2016, I was a Research Associate and Senior Researcher at the University of Oxford’s eResearch Centre.
